description.narrative: Although the canteen on Tibu farm in Kenya was built two years ago, 250 employees who work there can not use it most of the time ,as the canteen is not operational 6 days a week .The canteen only use the harvested rain water which is not sufficient to make the canteen fully functional. In cooperation with Mara Farming( fruit and vegetable producer and exporter) , Albert Heijn Foundation and ICCO the project aims to build a borehole to ensure that employees can use the canteen, have access to safe drinking water and also be able to take some of the clean water home for cooking.
Building a borehole on the Tibu farm

Tibu Farm is an 1100 acres vegetables farm which produce French beans, runner beans and barley. They also produce some fruits like avocados and passion fruit. All produce is aimed for export. There are 250 employees who live in a radius of 20 km around the farm.Mara Farming is a fruit and vegetable producer and exporter, founded in 2013 with main operations in Kenya and operates (some) of the farms formerly owned by Indufarm.
The canteen that was constructed two years ago does function well and
